intro: Aciella, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. It typically features small, delicate flowers in shades of white, yellow, or purple, often arranged in clusters. The plants are generally low-growing and thrive in rocky or sandy soils, often found in alpine or arctic regions. Aciella species are characterized by their basal leaves and often have a biennial or perennial life cycle. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in harsh environments.
